name: OpenELEC RPi Config
tagline: Unofficial Raspberry Pi configuration add-on for OpenELEC
body:
![icon.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/18055122/repo/script.openelec.rpi.config/icon.png)

**This add-on makes it possible to edit the Raspberry Pi system [configuration](http://elinux.org/RPiconfig) parameters in /flash/config.txt from the XBMC gui.**

## Installation

1. Install my XBMC repository from [xbmc.repo.leopold.zip](http://goo.gl/MpUAWy).
1. Install **OpenELEC RPi Config** from **Leopold's Add-ons** under **Services**.

By installing this way you ensure that the add-on is kept up-to-date as I push out updates to the repository.

Here is the latest [changelog](https://raw.github.com/LS80/script.openelec.rpi.config/master/changelog.txt).

## Screenshots

![Custom overclocking screenshot](http://ls80.github.io/script.openelec.rpi.config/screenshots/screenshot000.png "Custom overclocking settings")

## Usage

Currently only a subset of all possible properties can be configured. The complete list is shown below.

#### Overclocking
* arm_freq
* core_freq
* sdram_freq
* over_voltage
* over_voltage_sdram
* force_turbo
* initial_turbo

#### Video
* gpu_mem
* hdmi_force_hotplug
* hdmi_drive
* hdmi_force_edid_audio
* hdmi_pixel_encoding
* hdmi_ignore_hotplug
* sdtv_mode
* sdtv_aspect
* disable_overscan
* overscan_scale
* overscan_left
* overscan_right
* overscan_top
* overscan_bottom

#### Misc
* decode_MPG2
* decode_WVC1
* hdmi_ignore_cec
* disable_splash

For more information see http://elinux.org/RPiconfig.

## Reporting Issues

If you get a script error or other problem please raise an [issue](https://github.com/LS80/script.openelec.rpi.config/issues/new). If you can reproduce the problem then please include a debug log, by following these steps:

* [Turn on XBMC debugging](http://wiki.xbmc.org/index.php?title=Log_file#Enable_Debugging).
* Turn on the 'Debug' option in the add-on advanced settings.
* Restart XBMC to start a clean log.
* Run the add-on again to reproduce the error.
* Upload the debug log. There are a couple of ways:
 1. Log in via ssh and run pastebinit ~/.xbmc/temp/xbmc.log
 1. Use the add-on "XBMC Log Uploader".
